articles.title: FM Spokesman Refutes Remarks of U.S. Secretary of State
articles.content:
FM Spokesman Refutes Remarks of U.S. Secretary of State
 Pyongyang, March 1 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK gave the following answer to the question raised by KCNA Saturday blasting U.S. Secretary of State Kerry's recent malignant mud-slinging at the DPRK:
					 Kerry in an interview on February 26 dared term the DPRK an "evil place" and next day he again pulled it up when he was releasing the U.S. Department of State's "Country Reports on Human Rights Practices for 2013." 
					
					 This is another vivid expression of the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK. 
					
					 The U.S. secretary of State obsessed with hostility toward the DPRK can hardly understand supreme leader Kim Jong Un's politics based on his love for the  people and  the situation of the DPRK where his people-first principle is being strictly observed thanks to it. Such hostile elements like Kerry would not like to see them though all other people in the world will be able to understand them in the future. 
					
					 Kerry's malignant invectives against the social system in the DPRK are no more than a manifestation of his frustration and outbursts let loose by the defeated as the DPRK is winning one victory after another despite the whole gamut of pressure upon it over the nuclear issue. 
					
					 Before blaming others, Kerry had better ponder over what to say of the U.S., tundra of human rights, as it commits horrible genocide in various parts of the world in disregard of international law under the signboard of "liberty" and "democracy". 
					
					 The above-said reports do not deserve even a passing note as they are peppered with all lies and hypocrisy. 
					
					 No matter what a wicked hypocrite he is, he should bear in mind that no pressure is workable on the DPRK. 
					
					 No problem can be solved between the DPRK and the U.S. as long as the U.S. persists in its hostile policy toward the DPRK. The DPRK will keep going its own way.

articles.title: Joint Appeal Issued to All Koreans
articles.content:
Joint Appeal Issued to All Koreans
 Pyongyang, March 1 (KCNA) -- The north's Council for the Reunification of Tangun's Nation and the south's Council for the Peaceful Unification of Tangun's Nation issued a joint appeal Saturday, the 95th anniversary of the March First Popular Uprising (March 1, 1919) recorded in the Korean nation' history of the struggle against foreign forces.
					 The full text of the appeal is as follows:
					
					 95 years have passed since the March First Popular Uprising, but the slogans for independence shouted by the martyrs of the uprising are still heard in the land of Korea and the mental and physical pain and material losses inflicted by the Japanese imperialists on the Korean nation remain unhealed wounds as the grudge of all members of the nation have not been settled.
					
					 Japan, however, is getting hell-bent on the moves to grab territory, covering up its crimes and distorting history, far from making a sincere apology, reflection and reparation for the past crime-woven history.
					
					 The prevailing situation calls upon all Koreans to turn out as one in a nationwide movement for the country's reunification to force Japan to liquidate all its past crimes and defend the sovereignty and dignity of the nation, united close under the unfurled banner of By Our Nation Itself.
					
					 Reflecting the unanimous will of the Tangun nation on the occasion of the 95th anniversary of the March First Popular Uprising, we ardently call as follows, bitterly condemning once again the aggression, plunder and killings committed by Japan in the past:
					
					 Independence is the life and soul of the nation and sycophancy and dependence on foreign forces lead to national ruin.
					
					 Let all the fellow countrymen get firmly united under the genuine patriotic banner, the banner of By Our Nation Itself to reject sycophancy and dependence on foreign forces and settle the issue of our nation by its concerted efforts.
					
					 Let all the fellow countrymen in the north, the south and abroad turn out as one in the nationwide movement for peace against war to defend this land permeated with the blood and soul of the forerunners by the concerted efforts and patriotic minds of our nation.
					
					 National unity is the supreme task of our nation with one and same blood, language, history and culture. Apart from this it is impossible to open air, land and sea routes, alleviate the sufferings of separated families and relatives and clear off the clouds of a nuclear war hanging over the nation.
					
					 Let us place the nation above the interests of all parties and factions, respect the interests common to the nation, put an end to the history of antagonism and confrontation and pave a wide avenue for improving the north-south relations.
					
					 We will as always firmly preserve the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and further expand the nationwide movement for putting spurs to the implementation of the declarations.
					
					 Let all Koreans make every sincere effort to do things helpful to mending the north-south relations, putting aside all other matters, from the standpoint of attaching importance to the nation and giving priority to it, no matter who they are, no matter where they live, irrespective of political view, religious belief, ideology and social system.
					
					 Let all Koreans resolutely shatter the moves of Japan to revive militarism and reinvade Korea by their concerted efforts and conduct a  more dynamic nationwide movement to force Japan to make an apology and reparation for its shuddering past crimes.
					
					 No force on earth can arrest the grand march for the  independent reunification of the Koreans advancing, united close as one, giving full play to the stamina of the homogeneous nation with Tangun as its ancestral father.
					
					 Let us all pool our efforts in the spirit of achieving public welfare and building a paradise under the uplifted banner of By Our Nation Itself and usher in the era of national reconciliation and cooperation, the June 15 era of reunification without fail this year.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Ushering in New Era of Reunification, Prosperity
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Ushering in New Era of Reunification, Prosperity
 Pyongyang, March 1 (KCNA) -- Today marks the 95th anniversary of the March First Popular Uprising. 
					 The Japanese imperialists illegally occupied Korea early in the 20th century, depriving the Korean nation of all its rights and wealth such as the right to existence through brutal fascist rule and imposing upon the Koreans the destiny of stateless people worse than a dog at the mourner's house. 
					
					 This touched off the towering wrath and spirit of resistance among them, leading to nationwide anti-Japanese resistance on March 1, 1919. 
					
					 The uprisers indomitably fought against the Japanese imperialist army and police's brutal suppression, chanting such slogans as "Long live independence of Korea!" and "The Japanese and troops, quit Korea!"
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday in an editorial says that the March First Popular Uprising was nationwide anti-Japanese patriotic resistance to regain the country usurped by the Japanese imperialists and establish national sovereignty. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 All Koreans should carry forward patriotism and self-sacrificing fighting spirit displayed by the uprisers to put an end to the history of national split woven with distrust and confrontation and usher in a new era of reunification and prosperity.
					
					 The issue of national reunification is the most important one related to the destiny of the Korean nation. 
					
					 Nearly seven decades have passed since the Korean nation was divided by outside forces. 
					
					 Human and material resources of Korea have been wasted for nothing, uniform development of the nation has been hindered and the danger of a nuclear war is increasing day by day owing to the territorial partition and national split that have persisted for several decades.
					
					 The vicious cycle of confrontation should never be allowed to repeat itself any longer. 
					
					 It is the only way for the Korean nation to achieve its prosperity to attain the reconciliation and unity of the entire nation and opt for reunification.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Implementing Inter-Korean Declarations
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Implementing Inter-Korean Declarations
 Pyongyang, March 1 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun in an article Saturday calls for respecting the inter-Korean declarations and successfully implementing them in order to prevent the danger of a war and ensure peace on the Korean peninsula.
					 The June 15 joint declaration clarifies that the issue of reunification of the country should be settled independently by the concerted efforts of Koreans who are responsible for it.
					
					 The October 4 declaration deals with wide-ranging issues arising in putting an end to military confrontation between the north and the south and achieving close cooperation in the efforts for detente and peace on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 How to approach the joint declarations is a touchstone distinguishing dialogue from confrontation, peace from war and reunification from division, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The negation of the declarations can hardly avoid confrontation and war.
					
					 It is beyond doubt that if the south Korean authorities respect the above-said declarations and come out for their implementation, this will help defuse tensions between the north and the south and open the gate to peace and peaceful reunification.
					
					 Actions for peace are just patriotic ones to protect the cradle of the nation and pave a wide avenue for shaping out the independent destiny.
					
					 The DPRK will as ever protect peace on the Korean peninsula and wage a more dynamic, patriotic struggle for independent and peaceful reunification of the country and prosperity common to the nation under the uplifted banner of the June 15 joint declaration and October 4 declaration.

articles.title: March First Popular Uprising in Korea
articles.content:
March First Popular Uprising in Korea
 Pyongyang, March 1 (KCNA) -- It has been 95 years since the March First Popular Uprising in Korea.
					 The uprising in Juche 8 (1919) was an eruption of the Koreans' pent-up resentment toward Japan's colonial rule.
					
					 After occupying Korea, the Japanese imperialists had engaged themselves in violent repression and plunder, contending that the Koreans should obey Japan's law or die.
					
					 The Korean nation's wrath at their brutal atrocities finally burst into an anti-Japanese demonstration in Pyongyang, which rapidly developed into a nationwide uprising.
					
					 A great number of patriotic people including workers, peasants, youths and students staged anti-Japanese demonstrations for several days, shouting the slogan "Independence of Korea".
					
					 Upset by the uprising, the Japanese imperialists mobilized all their aggression troops, military policemen and cops stationed in Korea and many policemen and troops from the Japan proper to indiscriminately crack down on the demonstrators with firing and put streets and villages into flames throughout Korea.
					
					 Three days after the start of the uprising, they rained bullets on tens of thousands of demonstrators from Mangyongdae and other areas marching to the Pothong Gate in Pyongyang, turning streets into a sea of blood.
					
					 From the first day of the uprising to the end of May, more than 7,500 innocent people were killed, 46 900 arrested and jailed and 15,900 wounded.
					
					 For fear that their criminal acts be known to the world, the Japanese imperialists cut off all communications with other countries.
					
					 What they did against the people in the struggle against the invaders was an anti-ethical crime. Many years have passed since then, but their heinous crimes are still kept in memory of the Korean people, who will surely force Japan to pay dearly for them.

articles.title: DPRK Foreign Ministry Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Ministry Delegation Back Home 
 Pyongyang, March 1 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK led by Vice-Minister Ri Kil Song came back home Saturday after visiting Iran.

articles.title: Meari Shooting Gallery Starts Service
articles.content:
Meari Shooting Gallery Starts Service
 Pyongyang, March 1 (KCNA) -- The remodeled Meari Shooting Gallery started service.
					 It has been face-lifted to suit the environment of the picturesque hillside in Chongchun Street and aesthetic needs of the times. There are various shooting ranges, archery grounds, video game facilities, restaurant and other service facilities. 
					
					 As soon as the gallery was opened to visitors on Saturday, it draws a large crowd of them.
					
					 It was crowded with school youth and children pleased to hit rabbits, deers and wild boars appearing on large displays in the ray gun shooting gallery and working people in the electronic gun shooting gallery feeling as if they were in the live-bullet shooting range.
					
					 The number of visitors to the 50 meter rifle shooting range, the 25 meter pistol shooting range and the 30 meter indoor archery ground grew as the time passed. 
					
					 The outdoor firing range behind the building of the indoor firing gallery also attracted interest of visitors.
					
					 They broke into applause when they hit moving targets such as pheasants, chickens and balloons one after another.
					
					 Uninterrupted laughter was heard from among service boys and girls and working people when the animals hit by them were presented to them.
					
					  People were deeply impressed to visit the room for education in shooting, shower, outdoor sporting ground and outdoor eating sites.

articles.title: Grand People's Study House Receives More Books and Information
articles.content:
Grand People's Study House Receives More Books and Information 
 Pyongyang, March 1 (KCNA) -- The Grand People's Study House has been provided with more books, data and information sources conducive to the work for educating all the people to be well versed in science and technology.
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un again sent a lot of books to the study house at the outset of the year.
					
					 Among them is "Collection of famous art and calligraphic works." It has a total of 108 volumes. They contain works created by famous artists and calligraphers of China.
					
					 Kim Jong Un has sent the study house over 21,770 volumes more than 50 times since early in Juche 101 (2012).
					
					 They cover various fields including politics, economy, military, culture, science and technology and sports.
					
					 Books providing wide-ranging knowledge in the field of core basic technologies and CDs dealing with sci-tech successes made in agriculture are greatly helpful to scientists in those fields.
					
					 Such books as "Essentials of psychology in sports and physical training", "Essentials of basketball and diagram of its technology and tactics" help officials in the field of sports, coaches and players broaden their horizons and put sports on a scientific basis.
					
					 Popular among kindergarten teachers and other teachers are such books for children as "Collection of world's famous tales for children", "Super challenger", "Excellent children's jugglery" conducive to developing the intelligence of children and pupils.

articles.title: S. Korean Religious Organization Accuses Japan of Reviving Militarism
articles.content:
S. Korean Religious Organization Accuses Japan of Reviving Militarism
 Pyongyang, March 1 (KCNA) -- The Council of Christian Churches of south Korea met the press Thursday in Seoul and released a statement denouncing the Japanese reactionaries for reviving militarism, according to the internet paper No-cut News of south Korea.
					 Japan which inflicted untold wounds upon Asian countries through its war of aggression and colonial rule over them is now working hard to revive militarism, the statement charged.
					
					 It urged Japan to immediately stop its dangerous move which will lead peace in Northeast Asia to a catastrophe.
					
					 Japan should have a correct cognition of its past history of aggression and abide by the Pacifist Constitution, the statement held.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Letter Posted by Swiss Organizations on Their Websites
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Letter Posted by Swiss Organizations on Their Websites 
 Pyongyang, March 1 (KCNA) -- The full text of the letter sent by supreme leader Kim Jong Un to the participants in the national conference of subworkteam leaders in the agricultural sector "Let Us Bring About Innovations in Agricultural Production under the Unfurled Banner of the Socialist Rural Theses" was posted by the Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea on their websites on February 18.
					 The work, made public on February 6, Juche 103 (2014), deals with the sea changes brought about in the socialist rural construction of the DPRK since the publication of the socialist rural theses (February 25, 1964) and indicates tasks and ways to finally settle the rural question.

articles.title: Papers Urge Japan to Liquidate Its Past Crimes as Early as Possible
articles.content:
Papers Urge Japan to Liquidate Its Past Crimes as Early as Possible
 Pyongyang, March 1 (KCNA) -- If Japan has a scrap of conscience, it should honestly admit all the unethical crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists including massacres of Koreans like the suppression of the March First Popular Uprising and made an apology and reparation for them, says DPRK papers in articles Saturday.
					 Rodong Sinmun says:
					
					 The acts of exterminating tribes and races committed by suzerain states in their colonies are being called into question in the new century, too, and there increase the moves to force those countries properly redeem their crimes.
					
					 However, Japan is trying to evade the settlement of its past crimes by resorting to sleight of hand. Instead it is denying and distorting history.
					
					 This proves what extent the shamelessness and inhumanity of those vulgar in morality have reached to evade the blame for the past crimes and avoid their liquidation at any cost.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries should clearly know that the Korean people remain unchanged in their will to force Japan to pay for the past crimes. Japan mercilessly violated the sovereignty and dignity of the Korean nation and imposed untold misfortunes and sufferings upon it.
					
					 Minju Joson says that all misfortunes and sufferings which the Japanese imperialists imposed upon the Korean people by illegally occupying Korea and enforcing the unheard-of harsh colonial rule can never be pardoned.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Highly Praised by British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Highly Praised by British Organization
 Pyongyang, March 1 (KCNA) -- The British branch of the Korean Friendship Association released a statement on February 13 to mark the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The statement said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il was born in the secret camp in Mt. Paektu on February 16, 1942.
					
					 Born as son of guerillas, he grew up in the crucible of the hard-fought anti-Japanese war and the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 He was a genuine leader of the people as he always found himself among popular masses, sharing joys and sorrows with them.
					
					 He began his Songun revolutionary leadership by giving field guidance to Seoul Ryu Kyong Su Guards 105th Tank Division of the Korean People's Army in August, 1960 and started his work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea in June, 1964.
					
					 He developed the Juche idea through his energetic ideological and theoretical activities and defended socialism by leading the DPRK in the grim period of the Arduous March.
					
					 And he pursued Songun politics, a treasured sword for winning a sure victory, under the uplifted banner of Songun.
					
					 The DPRK has grown stronger thanks to supreme leader Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Theses on Socialist Rural Question Praised by Foreign Organizations
articles.content:
Theses on Socialist Rural Question Praised by Foreign Organizations
 Pyongyang, March 1 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea released a joint statement on February 17 on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the theses on the socialist rural question.
					 The statement said:
					
					 50 years have passed since President Kim Il Sung made public a work "Theses on the Socialist Rural Question in Our Country".
					
					 In the theses the President clearly laid down the fundamental principles to be held fast to in socialist rural construction.
					
					 The theses serve as highly important guidelines for socialist rural construction.
					
					 The great vitality of the theses has been displayed in the DPRK.
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un in his recent historic letter referred to the sea changes that have taken place since the publication of the theses.
					
					 Theses of Kim Il Sung opened a bright prospect for agricultural development in the DPRK.
					
					 The validity of the theses is now being fully demonstrated.
					
					 We are sure that the Korean people will register fresh successes under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Internet Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Exploits Held
articles.content:
Internet Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Exploits Held
 Pyongyang, March 1 (KCNA) -- An internet seminar of East European and Central Asian regions was held on February 19 and 20 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il and the 40th anniversary of his proclamation of the programme for modeling the whole society on Kimilsungism.
					 Mikhail Panchenko, general secretary of the International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions, said that Kim Jong Il was a peerlessly great patriot and tender-hearted father of the people who devoted his all to the building of a thriving nation, possessed of intense loyalty to President Kim Il Sung and the ardent love for the country and its people.
					
					 His life was scared one of a great man who performed immortal exploits on behalf of the party, revolution, his motherland and people, the general secretary noted.
					
					 Oleg Novikov, chairman of the February 16 Youth Society for the Study of Juche Idea and Songun Politics of Belarus, said it was significantly observing the 40th anniversary of Kim Jong Il's proclamation of the programme for modeling of the whole society on Kimilsungism. He reiterated his resolution to intensify the activities for studying and disseminating Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.
					
					 Dmitri Kostenko, chairman of the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that supreme leader Kim Jong Un set forth the modeling of the whole society on Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism as the supreme programme of the Workers' Party of Korea and has wisely led the struggle for accomplishing it.
					
					 Oleg Vernik, chairman of the Moldovan Songun Youth Union for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that Kim Jong Il's revolutionary career was noble one as he dedicated himself to the prosperity of the country and the happiness of its people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Celebrated Worldwide
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Celebrated Worldwide
 Pyongyang, March 1 (KCNA) -- The birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (Day of the Shining Star) was celebrated worldwide with splendor.
					 Brisk preparations were made to celebrate the Day of the Shining Star as the common holiday of humankind most grandiosely and significantly.
					
					 Preparatory committees were organized one after another in at least 50 countries and regions including Russia, Iran, Cambodia, Nepal, Uganda, Benin, Romania, Austria, France and Mexico in the wake of the formation of the Bangladeshi preparatory committee for celebrating the Day of the Shining Star on January 16. The committees consisted of prominent figures of various circles.
					
					 Events such as meeting, seminar, lecture, round-table talks, book and photo exhibition and film show took place in more than 100 countries and regions under the sponsorship of the preparatory committees, governments, political parties and organizations in those countries.
					
					 Kimjongilia exhibitions were held before full houses in Shenyang and Dalian of China, Nakhodka of Russia and Ulan Bator of Mongolia.
					
					 Progressive political parties and organizations of Peru held a national meeting.
					
					 Seminars on the sacred revolutionary career and immortal exploits of the peerlessly great man took place in Russia, Sweden, Indonesia and DR Congo significantly.
					
					 Political parties, ministries, organizations, organs of different countries, international organizations and personages of various circles sent floral baskets and bouquets to DPRK missions in the relevant countries and paid congratulatory visits to them in reverence for Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They included the king and the great queen of Cambodia, the Commission for External Affairs of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam and ministries of Foreign Affairs, Defence and Public Security of Vietnam, Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar, People's Socialist Party of Mexico, Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, a Chinese company, Hong Kong Zhonghwa Energy Fund Commission of China, Council of the Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation, Lao minister of Defence and the general secretary of the Central Committee of the New Communist Party of Britain.
					
					 Political parties, organizations and personages of various circles of different countries released statements praising the immortal exploits performed by Kim Jong Il. They included the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle, Switzerland-Korea Committee, Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, president of the Socialist Party of Benin and the general secretary of the Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist).
					
					 Media of many countries gave wide publicity to the sacred revolutionary career of the peerlessly great man who provided the eternal foundation for the prosperity of Kim Il Sung's nation.

articles.title: Book "Kim Jong Un's Politics Today" Off Press in Japan
articles.content:
Book "Kim Jong Un's Politics Today" Off Press in Japan
 Pyongyang, March 1 (KCNA) -- The book "Kim Jong Un's Politics Today" (I See through works) was published in Japan some days ago.
					 The book was written by Takashi Nada, representative of the Ehime Institute for Contemporary Korean Issue in Japan.
					
					 It carried photos dealing with the immortal exploits of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 It also carried his works, major calendar of his revolutionary activities and explanation on terms of the works.
					
					 The author wrote in a preface "The DPRK remains unchanged" that after the demise of General Secretary Kim Jong Il the DPRK has remained "unchanged" thanks to First Secretary Kim Jong Un who is successfully carrying forward the cause of Kim Jong Il. He said he wrote the book in a bid to make the Japanese know about it correctly.
					
					 He wrote in an epilogue "One should know the DPRK correctly" that world-startling miracles and innovations have been made one after another in the DPRK under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Un. He put an emphasis once again on the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un who is successfully realizing the plan of Kim Jong Il for building a thriving nation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Gives Field Guidance to Pyongyang Weak-current Apparatus Factory
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Gives Field Guidance to Pyongyang Weak-current Apparatus Factory 
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, gave field guidance to the Pyongyang Weak-current Apparatus Factory. 
					 After being briefed on the monument to the revolutionary activities of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and the monument to the instructions given by them, he went round the room for the education in the revolutionary history.
					
					 Going round several places of the factory, he learned in detail about production. 
					
					 The President and Kim Jong Il reposed deep trust in the factory, showing profound concern and attaching importance to it.
					
					 Kim Jong Un highly praised its officials, scientists, technicians and workers for honoring national economy plans on all indices every year, bearing their behests deep in mind. 
					
					 He saw the assembled weak-current apparatuses with keen interest.
					
					He said that the products of the factory have proved very efficient in practice and they are high in demand. 
					
					 The factory has been able to achieve successes in production in the past as it has solved all problems by dint of science and technology, keeping science and technology ahead of production, he said, expressing satisfaction over the traits of attaching importance to science and technology prevailing in the factory. 
					
					 He gave the factory an instruction to pay deep attention to the work for increasing the production of weak-current apparatuses and, at the same time, steadily improving their quality and fully guaranteeing trust in the products. 
					
					 He learnt in detail about the development of new apparatuses. 
					
					 He was pleased to learn that the employees of the factory are  pooling their creative enthusiasm and wisdom and actively introducing latest science and technology, true to the intention of the party to research and develop new Korean-style modern weak-current apparatuses, thereby achieving big successes in the development of new products. 
					
					 It is necessary to independently develop new type ones which can hardly be found in any existing technological books from a Juche-oriented viewpoint and stand with a high ambition to produce something which others do not venture, he said, specifying ways to do so. 
					
					 The party has a very great expectation for the workers of the factory, he said, expressing the hope and belief that all of them would become creators and developers of new technology, work miracles and perform exploits in the development and production of latest weak-current apparatuses. 
					
					 He was accompanied by Kang Kwan Il, Hwang Pyong So and Hong Yong Chil, vice department directors of the Central Committee of the WPK.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun llama a abrir la nueva era de reunificacion y prosperidad
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun llama a abrir la nueva era de reunificacion y prosperidad
 Pyongyang, 1 de marzo (ACNC) -- Hoy se cumple el 95o aniversario del Levantamiento Popular del Primero de Marzo. 
					 A principios del siglo 20, los imperialistas japoneses ocuparon ilegalmente a Corea y practicaron la dominacion fascista. 
					
					 De esta manera, arrebataron todos los derechos, riquezas y hasta el derecho a la vida de la nacion coreana imponiendole el destino de apatrida. 
					
					 La acumulada colera y la rebeldia de la nacion coreana explotaron el primero de marzo de 1919 como sublevacion antijaponesa pannacional. 
					
					 Los sublevados lucharon sin vacilacion ante la represion salvaje de los militares y policias japoneses gritando las consignas como "!Viva la independencia de Corea!" y "!Fuera los japoneses y sus tropas!". 
					
					 En el editorial de este sabado, el diario Rodong Sinmun califica el Levantamiento Popular de una resistencia patriotica antijaponesa para restaurar el pais y rescatar la soberania nacional, y continua: 
					
					 Toda la nacion coreana debe poner el punto final a la historia de division nacional caracterizada por la desconfianza y la confrontacion, continuando el patriotismo y el espiritu de sacrifico de los rebeldes de aquel entonces, y abrir la nueva era de reunificacion y prosperidad. 
					
					 El problema de reunificacion de la patria es el asunto mas importante que esta relacionado con el destino de la nacion. 
					
					 Ya pasaron cerca de 70 anos desde que el pais fuera dividido en dos partes por las fuerzas extranjeras. 
					
					 Debido a la division territorial y nacional que perdura siglo tras siglo, se consumen inutilmente los recursos humanos y materiales, se restringe el desarrollo unificado de la nacion y se aumenta cada dia mas el peligro de guerra nuclear. 
					
					 No se debe repetir nunca mas el circulo vicioso de enfrentamiento. 
					
					 Lograr la reunificacion, la reconciliacion y la unidad de toda la nacion es la via de prosperidad.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun insiste en ejecucion de declaraciones conjuntas N-S
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun insiste en ejecucion de declaraciones conjuntas N-S
 Pyongyang, 1 de marzo (ACNC) -- En un articulo individual del dia primero, el diario Rodong Sinmun insiste en que para prevenir la guerra y mantener la paz en la Peninsula Coreana, se debe respetar las declaraciones conjuntas y ejecutarlas sinceramente.
					 La Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio refiere que la reunificacion del pais debe ser alcanzada de manera independiente con las fuerzas unidas de todos los coreanos, autores de la solucion de asuntos nacionales, senala el articulista y continua:
					
					 La Declaracion del 4 de Octubre aclara los problemas profundos para estrechar la cooperacion con el proposito de acabar con las relaciones militarmente hostiles entre ambas partes coreanas, relajar la tension y preservar la paz en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					 Por eso, la posicion y la actitud sobre las dos declaraciones sirven de pauta que determina la postura sobre el dialogo o la confrontacion, la paz o la guerra y la reunificacion o la division.
					
					 Si se desprecian los dos documentos, no se puede evitar nunca la confrontacion ni la guerra.
					
					 Sin duda alguna, cuando las autoridades surcoreanas respeten las declaraciones y las ejecuten, se aliviara la tension entre ambas partes coreanas y se abrira la puerta de paz y reunificacion pacifica.
					
					 La lucha por preservar la paz es la justa y patriotica para defender el nido de vida de la nacion y forjar el destino nacional de manera independiente.
					
					 Al igual que en el pasado, la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea seguira librando la lucha patriotica por defender la paz de la Peninsula Coreana y alcanzar la reunificacion independiente y pacifica y la prosperidad comun de la nacion levantando en alto la bandera de las declaraciones N-S.

articles.title: MINREX condena la calumnia de Kerry sobre la RPDC
articles.content:
MINREX condena la calumnia de Kerry sobre la RPDC
 Pyongyang, 1 de marzo (ACNC) -- Con respecto a la reciente calumnia contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea del secretario de Estado norteamericano, Kerry, el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC dio el dia primero la siguiente respuesta a la ACNC: 
					 En una entrevista concedida el 26 de febrero pasado, el secretario de Estado norteamericano Kerry calumnio a la RPDC como "antro del mal" y al dia siguiente, la insulto nuevamente al publicar el llamado "informe de la situacion de DDHH de los paises en 2013". 
					
					 Sus palabras resultan otra expresion coherente de la politica hostil de EE.UU. sobre la RPDC. 
					
					 Es imposible que el secretario de Estado de EE.UU., enviciado con la hostilidad a la RPDC, vea la politica de amor al pueblo del Mariscal Kim Jong Un ni la realidad de la RPDC donde se da primacia a las masas populares. Ni en el futuro querran verlas los elementos hostiles como Kerry aunque lo haga todo el mundo. 
					
					 Kerry calumnia ahora el regimen de la RPDC porque se siente frustrado y derrotado ante la realidad de ella que avanza victoriosamente sin vacilar ni un comino ante la escalada de presion en el problema nuclear. 
					
					 Si es secretario de Estado, el debera pensar primero, antes de acusar a otros, en como calificar a su pais EE.UU., infierno de derechos humanos que bajo el rotulo de "libertad" y "democracia", comete masacres por doquier del Planeta sin tomar en consideracion ni el derecho internacional. 
					
					 No vale la pena discutir el informe de DDHH presentado por el porque es un viejo paquete de fraudes e hipocresia.
					
					 Por muy hipocrita que fuera el, le hace falta saber que ninguna presion saldra con la suya en caso de la RPDC. 
					
					 Mientras EE.UU. sigue hostilizando a la RPDC, no se resolvera ningun problema entre ambos paises y la segunda seguira marchando en su camino.
